description: This course is situated within the frameworks of publishing studies and creative writing. It prepares students for careers as authors, editors, and publishers: by introducing them to current professional practices and conditions of authorship; by developing fundamental skills at all levels of editing; and by exploring contemporary print and digital publishing practices and processes.
prerequisites: 8 units of advanced courses from the writing major or extended major, or permission of the course coordinators.
restricted: This course may be cancelled if there are less than 20 students enrolled.
